page.title: 19Morton Churches
page.content: St. Paul's church,Morton stands in the parish of Gainsborough on a site given by Henry Bacon Hickman Esq.,Lord of the Manor of Gainsborough and Thonock.All that remains of the original church is the tower.The rest of the building was rebuilt and enlarged in 1891.Sir Hickman Bacon Bart.,the premier baronet of England generously donated the larger part of the total cost.The stained glass windows,designed by Burne-Jones are the church's finest feature. The Methodist church stands in Dog and Duck Lane.An earlier chapel existed on the site of Belvoir Close.It was called the Morton Ebenezer Chapel and was built in 1796,50 years before St.Paul's.Prior to its building services were held in the malt-kiln on Walkerith Road.The present church was built in 1893.
